  • Exports
  Source   Edit

A temporary module that implements convenience routines for the PNode AST <-> MirTree translation.

With the current implementation, the code-generators are responsible for running both translation steps (plus any MIR passes), but this is the wrong approach -- the code reaching the code-generators should have already been processed (i.e. MIR translation and passes done).

Imports

../ast/ast_types, ../ast/ast_idgen, ../ast/ast, ../front/options, astgen, mirtrees, mirgen, sourcemaps, utils, ../modules/modulegraphs, ../sem/injectdestructors, ../sem/varpartitions, ../utils/astrepr

Procs

proc canonicalize(graph: ModuleGraph; idgen: IdGenerator; owner: PSym;
                  body: PNode; options: set[GenOption]): PNode {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, Exception, ValueError, ERecoverableError],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadDirEffect].}
No MIR passes exist yet, so the to-and-from translation is treated as a canonicalization step. To be able to step-by-step rewrite transformations done in transf and in the back-ends as MIR passes, it is important that canonicalize is applied to all code reaching the code-generators, so that they can depend on the shape of the resulting AST   Source   Edit 
proc canonicalizeSingle(graph: ModuleGraph; idgen: IdGenerator; owner: PSym;
                        n: PNode; options: set[GenOption]): PNode {.
    ...raises: [Exception, KeyError, ERecoverableError],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadDirEffect].}
Similar to canonicalize, but accepts a freestanding expression or statement. The owner is used as the owner when generating the necessary new symbols or types   Source   Edit 
proc canonicalizeWithInject(graph: ModuleGraph; idgen: IdGenerator; owner: PSym;
                            body: PNode; options: set[GenOption]): PNode {.
    ...raises: [Exception, ERecoverableError, KeyError, ValueError],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadDirEffect].}
Transforms body through the following steps:
  1. cursor inference
  2. translation to MIR code
  3. application of the injectdestructors pass
  4. translation back to AST

Cursor inference and destructor injection are only performed if owner is eligible according to injectdestructors.shouldInjectDestructorCalls
